intro: Assonia loucoubensis, commonly known as the Cameroon starling tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage and showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
